channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024030905
item.description:
Report X-2024030905

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM THE UNLOAD WITH WET SIDES OF THE BOX. DUE TOT HE HAZADOUS LABELING THE PACKAGE WAS BROIGHT TO QA AND THE ADMIN PLACED PACKAGE IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM DescribePack: ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS SEALED IN YELLOW DRUM AND PLACED IN CAGE

item.title: Report X-2024030701
item.description:
Report X-2024030701

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Loaders called in hazmat leakage. QA responded to call. Upon investigating found loose cap which caused leakage of liquid. Soaked up excess liquid with hazmat spill pad and placed container in hazmat bag/tub DescribePack: Cap sealing container smashed in which caused leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: hazmat spill pads were used to soak up excess

item.title: Report X-2024030776
item.description:
Report X-2024030776

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was unloaded and then scanned at 5:13am then i was called to check to see if package was leaking at 8:00 am and found that it was leaking possibly turned on its side. DescribePack: package was dropped on its side forcing liquid to come out the cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: put the package in a bin with a plastic bag

item.title: Report X-2024030920
item.description:
Report X-2024030920

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package found on trailer number 451842 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 4 x 1-gallon plastic bottles of sizzle scale remover 2 x 1-gallon plastic bottles of sizzle scale remover had loose caps allowing .25 gallons to release from each bottle package had slotted partitions and bags no absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 2 x 1-gallon plastic bottles of sizzle scale remover had loose caps allowing .25 gallons to release from each bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package found on trailer number 58590 already damage wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 2 x 2.5 gallons plastic bottle of noble low temp sanitizer 1 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottle of noble low temp sanitizer had a loose cap allowing .25 gallon to release from container package had no slotted partitions, bags, or absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottle of noble low temp sanitizer had an loose cap allowing .25 gallon to release from bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER ARRIVED IN PROPER PPE WITH DECISION TREE IN HAND. FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE FOR PROPER RESPONSE AND CLEAN UP. AFTER CLEAN UP, HAZMAT WAS TAKEN TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHIR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024030480
item.description:
Report X-2024030480

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030480 SequenceEvent: Package was received from unload wet and leaking, upon closer inspection it was revealed that the caps were loose on the hazardous product, thus causing the leakage. DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed package in drum in Hazmat Cage. 2. X-2024030481 SequenceEvent: Package came down the flex slide leaking, upon further investigation it was revealed that the cause of the leak was caused by the loose caps, causing the leakage. DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in Hazmat drum in the Hazmat Cage

Report X-2024030685

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on load side obviously leaking. Package was taken to QA, upon further inspection I saw a corrosive label and immediately performed the damaged hazmat process. DescribePack: Loose and missing cap on one bottle with no contents inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a tote.

item.title: Report E-2024030413
item.description:
Report E-2024030413

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Greencastle, PA. The spill consists of 6-750ML plastic cartridges of V7206-D Make Up Fluid, which were discovered crushed inside of a box from excessive freight stacked on top of it. The amount spilled could not be quantified.

item.title: Report E-2024030303
item.description:
Report E-2024030303

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: West Chester
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When loading freight into trailer forklift operator hit a drum that was already staged in the trailer with the forkblade of his forklift puncturing the drum contributing to the unintentional release. Drum was immediate laid on its side and spilled material was cleaned with absorbent material and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.
